intro: Heptanthus ranunculoides, commonly known as the broadleaf thimbleweed, is a herbaceous perennial native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes other shrubs and flowering plants. The plant features a basal rosette of broad, heart-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers in early spring. Its botanical structure is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, cup-shaped inflorescences. It thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in woodland areas.
